intro: Pithecoctenium panamense, commonly known as the Panamanian spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
